description: {{nihongo|'''Akiko Futaba'''|二葉 あき子|''Futaba Akiko''|born '''Yoshie Kato''' ({{nihongo2|加藤 芳江}}); February 2, 1915 – August 16, 2011}} was a Japanese popular music (''[[ryūkōka]]'') singer. As of the end of [[World War II]], she was one of the most popular female singers in Japan, competing with [[Hamako Watanabe]] and [[Noriko Awaya]]. In addition, she took part in the ''[[Kōhaku Uta Gassen]]'', one of Japan's most famous annual musical television shows, ten times.
